entry.title: British Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that following World War II, members of Bangkok's British Club were able to reclaim their building (pictured) thanks to a mortgage that helped preserve its land deeds?

entry.title: Joachim Werzlau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Joachim Werzlau composed the music for the DEFA films Naked Among Wolves and Jacob the Liar?

entry.title: A Human Work (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the name of the robot Jet Alone, which first appeared in the Neon Genesis Evangelion episode "A Human Work", is a reference to Jet Jaguar (also known as Red Alone) from Godzilla vs. Megalon?

entry.title: Franc Pinter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Franc Pinter, a para-shooter from Slovenia, competes at his eighth Summer Paralympic Games in Tokyo?

entry.title: Nicoll Highway MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Singapore's Nicoll Highway MRT station had to be relocated as a result of a 2004 tunnel collapse near the station?

entry.title: KNUE (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Texas radio station KNUE was sold to another station in 1982, the new owners added a second story to their newly constructed studios to accommodate the addition?

entry.title: causing catastrophic flooding (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that more than 400 millimetres (16 in) of rain was recorded in northern Turkey on 11 August 2021, causing catastrophic flooding?

entry.title: Fatykha Aitova (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fatykha Aitova agreed to marry her husband on the condition that he help her construct a school?
